profile.name: Ricky
profile.bio: React Core @facebook. ‚öõÔ∏è Building the next gen of UI, dabbling in #AI. Passionate about developer experience & open source. Sometimes I tweet hot takes. Learning out loud.

tweets.content: The beauty of a well-architected frontend system is how rarely you think about its architecture. It just... works. Striving for that invisible elegance every day. #SoftwareDesign #Frontend

Just finished a small internal script to automate some repetitive test setup for the React repo. It's amazing how much time small quality-of-life improvements can save for the whole team. #DX #OpenSource

Spent the morning discussing patterns for Concurrent React's server components interaction. The future of data fetching and rendering is going to be wildly different and incredibly powerful. #React #FrontendArchitecture

Diving deep into WebAssembly modules for some experimental FFI work today. The potential for heavy compute tasks in the browser is fascinating. Any good resources for practical WASM+JS patterns? #WebAssembly #Frontend

One thing I love about working on React Core is the constant challenge of balancing innovation with stability for millions of users. It's a high bar, and it makes you a better engineer. #Career #SoftwareEngineering

The relentless pace of frontend tooling innovation is both exhilarating and exhausting. Is it time for a more stable, batteries-included standard for browser module loading, or do we love the churn too much? #Frontend #BuildTools
Just merged a PR that cleans up some legacy `scheduler` API usage in a test file. Small win, but it makes the codebase incrementally better. Every contribution counts! #OpenSource #React

TypeScript is great, but sometimes I feel we're over-engineering type definitions for utility functions that could just be `any` or inferred. The cost/benefit curve isn't always linear. Discuss. #TypeScript #Frontend
Just spent 30 minutes debugging why a button wasn't clicking, only to realize I had `pointer-events: none;` on its parent. Peak Monday. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è #DeveloperLife #Frontend

Another great week pushing some exciting improvements to React DevTools internally. So much thoughtful work goes into making the developer experience smoother. Proud to be part of it. ‚ú® #React #DevTools
Trying to grok the nuances of `display: contents` for accessibility. Seems powerful but has some tricky implications. Any a11y experts out there with pro-tips? #a11y #CSS

Unpopular opinion: If your React app relies heavily on `useCallback` and `useMemo` for performance, you might be over-optimizing or have deeper architectural issues. Profile first, optimize second. #React #Performance
My brain trying to parse legacy JS code without types vs. my brain trying to parse a new Rust macro: two different levels of 'what even is this'. üòÇ #Programming

Playing around with `@swc/core` for faster JS parsing and transformation. The Rust ecosystem tooling for frontend is seriously impressive. Might be time to port some internal build steps. #Rust #Frontend

Me: 'I'll just refactor this small component.'
*3 hours later, 5 files open, 3 coffee cups empty, existential dread creeping in*
'Okay, maybe tomorrow.' #CodingHumor #DevLife
If your CI takes longer than 5 minutes for a frontend project, it's time to invest in better caching or distributed builds. Developer iteration speed is king. üëë #DevOps #Frontend

Reviewing a few RFCs for upcoming React features. It's awesome to see the community's engagement and diverse perspectives shaping the future of the library. Keep those ideas coming! #ReactRFC #OpenSource

Saw the latest Chrome dev release notes. Super excited about improved support for View Transitions API. Could be a game-changer for building fluid, single-page apps without complex animation libraries. #WebDev #Chrome
